    import {FormValidation} from 'validation-service/src/validation/formValidation/formValidation.js'
    public class | source

    FormValidation

    This Class offers form validation via html driven setup combined with customized or default validators

    Example:

    <form id="form">

<input name="name" id="name"
data-validation='{
"validators": {
"required": { "message": "Required \"name\" not set" } },
"feedbackDisplay": {
"messageLocation": [ { "minWidth": 0, "insertTargetSelector": "[for=\"name\"]" } ]
}
}'
>

<button id="submit-btn" type="submit">Validate Form</button>
</form>

<script type="text/javascript">

var options = {
formId: 'form',
caching: false
}

var validationService = new FormValidation( options );

var form = document.getElementById( 'form' );

form.addEventListener( 'submit', function( event ) {
event.preventDefault();

validationService.validateForm().then( function( result ) {
console.log( '----->validateForm success', result );
form.submit();
} ).catch( function( result ) {
console.log( '----->validateForm fail', result );
} );

} );

</script>

    Test:

    • FormValidation

    Initializes the validation service and field behaviour.

    setValues()

    Fills up the validation data values (Id of fields with it's value). This values are used to validate. ValidationService.validate, (ValidationServiceDom.setValueByField, ValidationService.getValue )

    updateConfigAndValuesAndBehaviour()

    This function should be called if any input fields have been added or deleted.

    validateForm(): Promise

    This function is validating the entire form.

    Public Constructors

    public constructor(options: Object) source

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    options Object

    The options to set. You have to set the form id for a minimal configuration setup.
    options.formId String

    (default=null} - Id of the form.
    options.caching Boolean
    • optional
    • default: true

    Enabling/disabling caching of form validation.
    options.stopValidationOnFirstFail Boolean
    • optional
    • default: true

    Stops further validation of field if one validator fails.
    options.condition Function
    • optional

    (default=condition) This condition function provides a condition for each field validation.
    options.Behaviour Class
    • optional

    (default=Behaviour) This Behaviour Class is setting up the validation behaviour for each field.
    options.validators Object
    • optional

    (default=defaultValidatorRequired, defaultValidatorEmail)
    options.feedbackDisplayOptions Object
    • optional

    (default=FeedbackDisplay.getOptions)

    public getValidationConfig(fields: Array): Object source

    Fills up validation config of fields via data attributes of fields and Id of each field. ValidationService

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    fields Array

    Array of field references to dom

    Return:

    Object

    Example:

    <input name="name" id="nameId"
   data-validation='{
          "validators": {"required": { "message": "This field is required" }
          }'>

{
    nameId: {
        required: { message: 'This field is required' }
    }
}

    public getValidationFieldConfig(fields: Array): Object source

    Merges the default field config getDefaultValidationFieldConfig for each field with the HTML given config.

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    fields Array

    Array of field references to dom

    Return:

    Object

    Return Properties:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    validators null | Object

    : null|Object
    feedbackDisplay Object
    caching Boolean

    : true|false
    setEventOnValidation Boolean

    : false|true
    behaviourGroupSel String

    : null|css selector

    Return:

    Array

    public init() source

    Does the required setup. Set in extra part - why? This allows to manipulate several objects for customization

    public setResolver(): Class source

    public setValidationAndBehaviour() source

    Initializes the validation service and field behaviour.

    public setValues() source

    Fills up the validation data values (Id of fields with it's value). This values are used to validate. ValidationService.validate, (ValidationServiceDom.setValueByField, ValidationService.getValue )

    public updateConfigAndValuesAndBehaviour() source

    This function should be called if any input fields have been added or deleted. or before a validation of the entire form starts (Its called by validateForm )

    public validateForm(): Promise source

    This function is validating the entire form.

    Return:

    Promise
